meanings.sent1: She always manages to outblush everyone in the room.
meanings.sent2: The little girl's cheeks outblushed the rose petals.
meanings.sent3: Her ability to outblush even the shyest person is quite impressive.
meanings.sent4: The sunset's beauty outblushed any painting I had ever seen.
meanings.sent5: His embarrassment outblushed the reddest tomato in the garden.

meanings.definition: To cause to blush more intensely than someone or something else.
meanings.sent1: The comedian's jokes outblush even the toughest audience members.
meanings.sent2: The romantic gesture outblushed her cheeks with a deep crimson hue.
meanings.sent3: His surprise gift outblushed her initial reaction.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected compliment outblushed all her previous compliments.
meanings.sent5: The embarrassing moment outblushed all other awkward encounters.
